intro: Chamaecladon, commonly known as the rock rose, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rosaceae. It consists of shrubs that are native to the Mediterranean region and parts of Asia. The plants are characterized by their dense, often evergreen foliage and showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in spring. Chamaecladon species typically thrive in rocky or well-drained soils and are drought-tolerant. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
